name: post_check
description: This table is used to store the results of compliance checks performed on transactions or activities to ensure they meet certain rules or standards.

columns.name: sym_run_date
columns.description: The date when the compliance check was executed.

columns.name: reference_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the compliance check record.

columns.name: rule_code
columns.description: The code representing the specific compliance rule being checked.

columns.name: rule_name
columns.description: The name of the compliance rule being applied.

columns.name: payload
columns.description: The data or content that is being evaluated against the compliance rule.

columns.name: dlh_source
columns.description: The source from which the data was obtained for the compliance check.

columns.name: dlh_created_time
columns.description: The timestamp when the compliance check record was created.

columns.name: dlh_processed_time
columns.description: The timestamp when the compliance check was completed.

columns.name: year
columns.description: The year part of the date when the compliance check was executed.

columns.name: month
columns.description: The month part of the date when the compliance check was executed.

columns.name: day
columns.description: The day part of the date when the compliance check was executed.

columns.name: count_cif_number_login_difference_device_in_1_day
columns.description: The number of times a customer identification file (CIF) number logged in from different devices in one day.

columns.name: count_kyc_id_in_1_day
columns.description: The number of times a Know Your Customer (KYC) ID was used in one day.
